He was a Christian philosopher and theologian, and is considered one of the most important figures in the history of Christianity. He was the bishop of Hippo Regius, in North Africa, from 396 to 430. Guru Nanak was born in 1469 in the village of Rai Bhoi Di Talwandi, now known as Nankana Sahib, Pakistan. He was the founder of Sikhism, and is considered to be the first Sikh Guru. Guru Nanak was born to a Hindu family, and was the son of a local government official. He was married at the age of 16, and had two sons. Friedrich Nietzsche was born in 1844 in the small town of Röcken, Germany. He was the son of a Lutheran pastor. Nietzsche was a brilliant student, and he studied at the University of Bonn, the University of Leipzig, and the University of Basel. In 1869, he became a professor of classical philology at the University of Basel. Nietzsche's most famous works include 'Thus Spoke Zarathustra,' 'The Gay Science,' and 'The Antichrist.' Milk was a gay rights activist and a member of the San Francisco Board of Supervisors. He was assassinated in 1978, along with Mayor George Moscone, by Dan White, a former supervisor. He was elected as the president of Bolivia in 2005, and was re-elected in 2009. Morales is the first indigenous president of Bolivia. George Washington was born in 1732 in Westmoreland County, Virginia. He was the son of Augustine Washington and Mary Ball Washington. Washington was a planter and surveyor, and he also served as a militia officer in the French and Indian War. In 1752, he married Martha Dandridge Custis, and they had 6 children. In 1775, Washington was appointed commander-in-chief of the Continental Army, and he led the American forces to victory over the British in the American Revolution. He was unanimously elected as the first president of the United States in 1789, and served two terms. He died in 1799.

Frida Kahlo was born in 1907 in Mexico City. She was a Mexican painter, who is best known for her self-portraits. Kahlo was married to the famous Mexican muralist, Diego Rivera. She was a feminist and a communist, and her paintings often reflected her political views. Kahlo died in 1954, at the age of 47. Her paintings are now considered to be a part of the Mexican cultural heritage.

Ashoka the Great was the third emperor of the Maurya Dynasty in India. He was born in 304 B.C.E. and was the son of the emperor Bindusara. Ashoka was a great warrior and conquered most of the Indian subcontinent. He was a Buddhist and became a great patron of Buddhism. Ashoka was a great ruler and is considered one of the greatest emperors in Indian history. He was also known as the 'Great Emperor.'

Slavoj Žižek is a Slovenian philosopher, cultural critic, and political activist. He was born in Ljubljana, Slovenia, in 1949. Žižek studied philosophy at the University of Ljubljana, and later at the University of Paris. He is currently a professor at the European Graduate School in Switzerland. Žižek is a prominent figure in the field of cultural studies, and has written numerous books on philosophy, psychoanalysis, and politics. He is also a frequent contributor to The Guardian, The New York Times, and The New York Review of Books.

Ailey was a dancer, choreographer, and the founder of the Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater. He was also a civil rights activist, and his work was inspired by the African-American experience. In 2009, she became the first South Korean to win an Olympic gold medal in figure skating. She is the first female skater to land a triple axel in competition. Born in 1954, Jackie Chan is a Chinese actor, director, producer, martial artist, and singer. He is known for his acrobatic fighting style, comic timing, use of improvised weapons, and innovative stunts. Chan has been acting since the 1960s, and has appeared in over 150 films. He is the only actor to have received star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame. Marie Curie was born in Warsaw, Poland, in 1867. She was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize, and the first person to win two Nobel Prizes. She was also the first woman to become a professor at the University of Paris. Curie was the first woman to be awarded the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1903, and the first woman to be awarded the Nobel Prize in Chemistry in 1911. She was also the first woman to become a member of the Royal Society of Chemistry. Curie died in 1934, and was buried in Paris.

Karl Marx was born in Trier, Germany, on May 5, 1818. He was the son of a Jewish lawyer, and was raised in a wealthy family. He studied law and philosophy at the University of Bonn, and later at the University of Berlin. In 1843, he married Jenny von Westphalen, and they had 3 children. In 1848, Marx was exiled from Germany, and moved to Paris. He then moved to London, where he lived until his death in 1883. Marx is best known for his work 'The Communist Manifesto,' which was published in 1848. He is also known for his theory of dialectical materialism, which is the idea that all matter is constantly changing.

Yoko Honda was born in 1985 in Tokyo, Japan. She is a singer, actress, and model. She is best known for her role as the lead singer of the Japanese pop group AKB48. She has also appeared in several Japanese television dramas. She is the first member of AKB48 to have a solo album.

Rachel Maddow was born in 1973 in Castro Valley, California. She attended Stanford University, where she earned a B.A. in public policy. She then went to Oxford University, where she earned a M.A. in politics. Maddow worked as a host on Air America Radio, and then she became a host on MSNBC. She is the host of the show 'The Rachel Maddow Show,' which airs on MSNBC. She is also the author of the book 'Drift: The Unmooring of American Military Power.'

Jamie Oliver was born in 1975 in Essex, England. He is a celebrity chef, restaurateur, and television personality. He is known for his campaigns to improve the quality of food in schools, and to improve the health of the nation. He has written several cookbooks, and has appeared on television shows such as 'The Naked Chef' and 'Jamie's Kitchen.' He has also appeared in the reality show 'Jamie's Food Revolution.'

John Maynard Keynes was born in 1883 in Cambridge, England. He was a British economist, and one of the most influential economists of the 20th century.
